question.title: JavaFX with Maven: “[WARNING] Module name not found in <mainClass>” how to resolve?
question.body:
I’m working on a JavaFX project using Maven in Eclipse. I am getting the following warning message when I run my project:

[WARNING] Module name not found in <mainClass>. Module name will be assumed from module-info.java

My project uses Java 23 with JavaFX 21 and includes a module-info.java file. I’m running the app using the javafx-maven-plugin. Everything compiles and runs, but I want to understand and remove this warning.

I did some searching and I believe the issue has something to do with the way my pom.xml file is set up I just am not quite sure how to fix it.

What I've Tried:

  • verified pom.xml includes org.openjfx:javafx-maven-plugin
  • verified that I have a module-info.java file
  • main class is inside the src/main/java folder under the correct package.

Project Structure:

helloFX/
 ├─ src/main/java/
 │   ├─ org/openjfx/hellofx/
 │   │   ├─ App.java (Main class)
 │   │─ module-info.java
 ├─ pom.xml

pom.xml Snippet:

<plugin>
<groupId>org.openjfx</groupId>
<artifactId>javafx-maven-plugin</artifactId>
<version>0.0.8</version>
<executions>
    <execution>
        <id>default-cli</id>
        <configuration>
            <mainClass>org.openjfx.hellofx.App</mainClass>
        </configuration>
    </execution>
</executions>

module-info.java Snippet:

module org.openjfx.hellofx {
    requires javafx.controls;
    requires javafx.fxml;

    opens org.openjfx.hellofx to javafx.fxml;
    exports org.openjfx.hellofx;
}

question_comments.body: When the project is modular, the javafx-maven-plugin plugin "wants" the main class to follow the <module>/<main-class> format (just like the --module argument of various JDK tools).
Possible duplicate of Module name not found in <mainClass>. Module name will be assumed from module-info.java
